00061 // Define system executor bit map. Used internally by runtime protocol as runtime command flags,
00062 // which notifies the main program to execute the specified runtime command asynchronously.
00063 // NOTE: The system executor uses an unsigned 8-bit volatile variable (8 flag limit.) The default
00064 // flags are always false, so the runtime protocol only needs to check for a non-zero value to
00065 // know when there is a runtime command to execute.
00066 #define EXEC_STATUS_REPORT  bit(0) // bitmask 00000001
00067 #define EXEC_CYCLE_START    bit(1) // bitmask 00000010
00068 #define EXEC_CYCLE_STOP     bit(2) // bitmask 00000100
00069 #define EXEC_FEED_HOLD      bit(3) // bitmask 00001000
00070 #define EXEC_RESET          bit(4) // bitmask 00010000
00071 /// LETARTARE  17/04/2014
00072 #define EXEC_ALARM          bit(5) // bitmask 00100000
00073 /// <---
00074 // #define                  bit(6) // bitmask 01000000
00075 // #define                  bit(7) // bitmask 10000000
00076 
00077 // Define global system variables
00078 typedef struct {
00079   uint8_t abort;                 // System abort flag. Forces exit back to main loop for reset.
00080   uint8_t feed_hold;             // Feed hold flag. Held true during feed hold. Released when ready to resume.
00081   uint8_t auto_start;            // Planner auto-start flag. Toggled off during feed hold. Defaulted by settings.
00082 /// -> 843 : 4 -> N_AXIS
00083   int32_t position[N_AXIS];      // Real-time machine (aka home) position vector in steps.
00084                                  // NOTE: This may need to be a volatile variable, if problems arise.
00085 
00086   uint8_t coord_select;          // Active work coordinate system number. Default: 0=G54.
00087 /// -> 843 : 4 -> N_AXIS
00088   double coord_system[N_COORDINATE_SYSTEM][N_AXIS]; // Work coordinate systems (G54+). Stores offset from
00089                                                     // absolute machine position in mm.
00090                                  // Rows: Work system number (0=G54,1=G55,...5=G59), Columns: XYZ Offsets
00091   double coord_offset[N_AXIS];   // Retains the G92 coordinate offset (work coordinates) relative to
00092                                  // machine zero in mm.
00093 /// <-
00094 
00095   volatile uint8_t cycle_start;  // Cycle start flag. Set by stepper subsystem or main program.
00096   volatile uint8_t execute;      // Global system runtime executor bitflag variable. See EXEC bitmasks.
00097 } system_t;
00098 extern system_t sys;
